definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: He was an unrivalled talent, but unfortunately at the wrong time.
sentences.chinese: 他是個舉世無雙的奇才，可惜生不逢時。

sentences.english: Welcome to HongKong, a peerless city in entire world.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎蒞臨香港，一個舉世無雙的城市。

sentences.english: It's part of the geography of China, and this is totally unique.
sentences.chinese: 它是中國地理的一部分，舉世無雙，無與倫比。

sentences.english: Pele was in a class of his own as a footballer.
sentences.chinese: 貝利是舉世無雙的足球健將。

sentences.english: He is unequaled, as a jazz player.
sentences.chinese: 他是位舉世無雙的爵士樂演奏者。

sentences.english: Ma Hung-Kuei's method of salt distribution was unique.
sentences.chinese: 馬鴻逵的食鹽專運專銷辦法可謂舉世無雙。

definition: after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes
heaven on Earth/nickname for the city Suzhou
